help.title: Estimation Guide
help.description: In Planning Poker, we use the Fibonacci sequence to estimate the relative effort of user stories.
help.fibonacciExplanation: The Fibonacci sequence (1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13) reflects the inherent uncertainty in estimates: the larger the estimate, the greater the uncertainty.

values.1: Very simple task, well understood and quick to implement.
values.2: Simple task with few details to resolve.
values.3: Low-medium complexity task, with a clear path.
values.5: Medium complexity task, may require research.
values.8: Complex task with multiple components or uncertainties.
values.13: Very complex task, should possibly be divided into subtasks.

tips: Estimate in terms of complexity and effort, not time.
Compare with other stories already estimated as reference.
If a story seems larger than 13, consider splitting it.
Team consensus is more important than absolute precision.
